meanings.definition: Of or relating to the nucellus.
meanings.sent1: The nucellar tissue provides nutrients to the developing seed.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the nucellar structure under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The nucellar cells were having a party, celebrating their important role.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like the nucellar support that nurtures growth.
meanings.sent5: The nucellar connection between the two organisms was crucial for survival.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the central part of an ovule.
meanings.sent1: The nucellar region is essential for seed development.
meanings.sent2: The botanist explained the nucellar position within the ovule.
meanings.sent3: The nucellar core of the ovule was surprisingly colorful.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed from the nucellar core of her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The nucellar essence of the ovule held the promise of new life.

meanings.sent1: The nucellar material protected the nucleus of the cell.
meanings.sent2: The researcher focused on the nucellar components of the cell.
meanings.sent3: The nucellar nucleus threw a tiny party for the other organelles.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like the nucellar core, holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The nucellar presence within the cell was vital for its function.
